title: Jane maximizes utility with more apples, less soda

content.question: Jane spends all her weekly allowance to buy only two goods: soda and apples. According to the table above, if her preferences are characterized by the law of diminishing marginal utility, then which of the following statements is correct?

choices.label: Jane can buy more apples and less soda to maximize her utility.
Jane can buy more soda and fewer apples to maximize her utility.
Jane can buy more apples and the same amount of soda to maximize her utility.
Jane can buy more soda and the same amount of apples to maximize her utility.

content.answer: Jane can buy more apples and less soda to maximize her utility.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
